There are 4 people who must cross a narrow bridge at night. They have one torch, and at most two can cross at a time. The torch must be carried whenever someone crosses, and when two cross together they move at the pace of the slower person.

Their *claimed* individual crossing times (in minutes) are: 3, 12, 13 and 16. Exactly 2 of them are exaggerating by **adding 1 minute** to their real time. Everyone else is telling the truth.

What is the *minimum* total time, in minutes, that this crossing could actually take?

What is the *minimum* total time, in minutes, that this crossing could actually take?
